title: DLT Entrepreneurship Toolbox
description: 初期段階の起業家は、有権者やステークホルダーがプロジェクトに価値を見出すことができるように、素晴らしいアイデアを実行し、伝えるスキルをどのようにして身につけることができるのでしょうか？

f6_assessments.q0:
Developing early stage entrepreneur skills is important and there are many external organizations and individuals that already provide this assistance however I do not see how it aligns with Cardano's mission statements in any way. This funding could be put to better use to automate the funding process to better weed out bad proposals while directing new entrepeneurs to third parties providing this education. A DID/verified credentials style application that tracked results from various Cardano proposal writing assistance services could be beneficial but it could be funded under a broader category.
I disagree this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
The DLT Entrepreneurship Toolbox challenge is new to fund 6. There are 23 proposals being assessed for $150K in funds which is less than the smaller but similar Proposer Outreach fund. Doubling the fund to $300K does not seem warranted based upon the relatively small number of submissions in F6. 
I neither agree nor disagree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are relevant to the challenge objectives. The key metrics are relevant to the success criteria. 
I agree that success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

importance: 起業家の強みは野心とビジョンだが、有権者の心をつかむためにアイデアを明確に伝える仕組みがないことが多い。
success: 起業家が自信を持ってプロジェクトの理念、USP、戦略、目的を提示できるようになることで、Catalystに提出される提案の質が向上する。
